definition: to relieve/to ease (pressure)/to alleviate/to remove/to get rid of
abundant/ample/at ease/relaxed/to free from/to relieve
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to transport under guard
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection
surname Xie

sentences.english: The apartments were built to ease the housing shortage.
sentences.chinese: 那些公寓被建造以纾解房屋匮乏。

sentences.english: Ms. Ehrlich recommends weekly massages for the pain.
sentences.chinese: 厄利建议每周按摩来纾解疼痛。

sentences.english: I always take a slow, deep breath to relieve tension.
sentences.chinese: 我总是借由缓慢的深呼吸来纾解紧张。

sentences.english: As they pulled, they sang to ease the pain.
sentences.chinese: 他们边拉边唱歌，纾解疼痛。

sentences.english: It is a perfect place to release all the tension and pressures.
sentences.chinese: 所有的压力与紧张感能在此得到全面的纾解与释放。

sentences.english: Do you think these measures are sufficient to relieve people's hardships?
sentences.chinese: 你认为呢D纾解民困既措施足唔足够？

sentences.english: Music can release stress in our daily life.
sentences.chinese: 音乐可以纾解日常生活中的压力。

sentences.english: That in turn will help ease the demand on our public mortuary .
sentences.chinese: 如此一来，又可纾解民众对殓葬服务的需求。

sentences.english: Used in bath water, it relieves rheumatalgia and has antiseptic action to urinary system.
sentences.chinese: 用来泡澡可纾解风湿痛，对泌尿系统亦有抗菌效果。

definition: to mediate/to reconcile/to make peace/to intervene
to divert oneself from (loneliness, grief etc)/to dispel (negative thoughts etc)
to drain (by leading off water)/to unburden oneself/to divulge/to leak a secret
to bring relief/to alleviate (a crisis)/to dull (a pain)
to give vent to (one's feelings)
to adapt (to an environment etc)/to make sth suitable/adaptation/adjustment/adaptive
to suffer from pent-up frustrations/mental knot/emotional issue
depressed/dejected/feeling low
to console/to comfort/to soothe
pent-up frustrations/sth that has accumulated in one's mind for a long time
moody/gloomy
to mediate/to mitigate/to ease/to relieve
to say everything (that is on one's mind)
to straighten out/to explain/to ease sb's anxiety
to pacify/to calm down/to be cured/to be healed
to ease (tension)/to relax/to cause sth to relax/to alleviate/relaxed/easy and unhurried/leisurely/soothing/mild (slope)
